articles.author: Bilal Qureshi
articles.title: How should we be 'Living'? Kurosawa and Ishiguro tackle the question, 70 years apart - WUSF Public Media
articles.description: As a kid, Kazuo Ishiguro saw Akira Kurosawa's 1952 film Ikiru. "It made a terrific impact on me," the Nobel prize-winner recalls. His film Living is nominated for an Oscar for best adapted screenplay.
